ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would say that this class is a lot of fun and is a real stress reducer and would definitely recommend it.
If you need machining in your experimental work, this course provide a good preparation.
I would strongly recommend Chemistry 562 for a fellow student.
Take it take it take it. Best class at Yale. Learn something useful.
build a steam engine, amazing class for practically minded people

Take this course. Being forced to build a particular part to within 5/1000ths of an inch of specifications is a terrific complement to the abstraction of most other Yale parts. Dave is a wonderful (and wonderfully patient) instructor, and best of all, you'll have something concrete to take home from this course for the rest of your life - a steam engine!
Perhaps the most fun part of our second semester.
If you want to get better at using mills, lathes, or the CNC machine, this is your class. Plus, you get to keep the mini steam engine that you build throughout the year when you finish.
Take this course. It's so incredibly awesome. Where else will you learn how to make a steam engine with machine tools?

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: as an experimental p-chemist, chances are you'll have to design your own instruments or fabricate special parts, in which case this class isideal.
This course help learning basic skills in machining required in experiments.
Made me more aware of realities of research and gave me a deeper appreciation of how scientific thinking directly forms and improves the modern world.
Dave, I think you are the man.
Made me aware of my love of designing and machining parts.
It's not really relevant to my specialties at all, but damn is it fun!
